storyInfo: Empress Grimmacht descends from the sky and destroys the Urticas' chamber. The scholar dies when the Witch King's powers backfire on him, and Arturia sends him on his way with her cello. Federico finally captures Arturia, only for the Empress's executor to take her away.

attributes.content: Wh-What the hell is that?
attributes.name: Frightened Student

attributes.content: The Witch King's Spire...? Is that the Witch King's Spire?!
attributes.name: Frightened Student

attributes.content: The Witch King is back. That terrifying tyrant... that evil caster... He's back!
attributes.name: Frightened Student

attributes.content: Stop, don't turn back. Don't push—
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Hahaha, where would you even run? This is the punishment that the great Herkunftshorn is laying down on us. Burn! Burn!
attributes.name: Enraged Student

attributes.content: What are you doing? You're attracting the flames!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: It's all over anyway. Why even bother lying to ourselves anymore, pretending to have dignity?
attributes.name: Enraged Student

attributes.content: Put out the fire! Put it out!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: In formation—
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: No, it's coming this way, the entire school is— There's no stopping it!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: The black flames engulf everything in their wake. Laughter, sobbing. Nothing is spared.
As the sound of thunder rips through the air, the thick layers of clouds above descend lower and lower, almost becoming one with the strange spire before them.
Some of the older students remember the history books that they happen to have read, deep inside the spire. The ones that went unburned.
They said that during the Battle of the Four Emperors, Herkunftshorn brought an Originium storm that ripped apart the skies above the battlefield, swallowing an entire Gaulish landship fleet at once.
And now, at that very same location, there remains a terrifying rift deep in the Catastrophe clouds, the screams of the sleepless dead reverberating within.
Herr Gesatzswächter, the curtain isn't going to hold.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: The students are all trying to escape. We can't stop them. Everyone has seen the spire. Sooner or later, the news will spread. Should we...
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Nein.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Lower the curtain. Concentrate all your energy on dealing with the black flames.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: It's not working!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: This assault was more than enough to decimate a vanguard of Kazimierzian campaign knights.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn's enchantments are not so easily removed.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: As the legend goes, the way he used Arts was fundamentally different from other casters. During the Battle of the Witch King's Spire years ago, only the Kaiserinnen were able to perform their melodies unimpeded. All other casters' Arts failed.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: ...That spire.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: We must lay siege to it, and take care of the problem at its source.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Brandt.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Do you hear that? The lightning has stopped.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: She's here! We're saved!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Everyone, defend.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The clouds begin to crack.
There is no sound, no shaking, and no omen of any kind. A bolt of purple-black lightning simply crashes down from high above.
Likewise, it is not accompanied by any kind of flashy explosion or shocking roar.
It merely pierces the spire's body and crushes the seemingly impenetrable tower, layer after layer, from top to bottom.
By the time the first piece of falling rubble reaches the ground, the reborn 'Witch King's Spire' has already ceased to be, as though it had never existed in the first place.
Finally, the earth starts trembling, as though reacting to the spire's fall.

Behind the wall of Arts conjured by the Imperial casters, the crowd stands in terror with their eyes wide open. At the highest point of the ruins, they see a figure holding a sword emitting purple-black sparks of lightning.
Herkunftshorn's shadow will no longer be permitted to shroud Leithanian soil.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Especially not that of a fake.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We're certainly dealing with a fake, but... it's really quite remarkable how easily his expectations were shattered.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A shame she's just like her blond twin. Their souls were molded by Arts enchantments, and I'm afraid there are few ripples that I can perform with.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's over.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What your plans were for the Gesatzswächter is now irrelevant. You have failed.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Federico, you are as impatient as ever. The climax of a piece is never its end.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia spreads her arms and falls backward into the air behind the railing.
Then, the remains of a sculpture lift her up, and she quickly rises even higher.
I'll be waiting for you at the end of the stairs.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What... just happened? The chamber rose... and then...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I grabbed you and jumped.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: That's right. You jumped without hesitation, without even checking on your poor old grandfather.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: There's no way anything would happen to you.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You heartless little runt.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Grimmacht really didn't hold back with her sword. If I hadn't pulled you two out in time, you'd have been buried in the dirt alongside all those masked men.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: What about Gerhard...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Is he dead?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: He ran.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: But he won't get far. His body can't withstand Herkunftshorn's Arts. He will collapse in no time, like an Infected with rapidly deteriorating symptoms.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Huff... hah...
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: *cough*... Haha... so my body... really cannot become the Genesis Horn's vessel.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: This sound...
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Hello, Herr Scholar.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You were... waiting for me?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Correct. I visited this school just for you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If you don't mind me asking... Would you be willing to allow my melody to accompany you, as you reach the end of your life?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Danke. To a Leithanian, there is nothing more romantic than... dying to the sound of beautiful music.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: My only regret is that Grimmacht came too soon, and I didn't get to meet Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: He didn't awaken, and there was no one to answer my question. If he was truly so great, then why... why was he killed by mere men like us? And why must I carry the burden of that decision?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: In the end, you remain tormented by regret.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But Herr Scholar, you have never truly been free. Why must you feel regret over past decisions?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I'm... not free?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Your tattered, weary heart is now laid bare before me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I can feel everything you feel. On the night of the battle at the Spire, your heart was filled with spite toward the tyrant. But aside from that... there was also doubt.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Of course. The man I was about to kill, Herkunftshorn, was the rightful ruler of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Then, what planted the seeds of that emotion?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You mean... what influenced me to think that?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Are you implying that someone was telling me to look up to Leithanien's king?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: I've visited many places and collected a variety of music. I found that although each of them has a unique style, they all share some commonalities in their origin. And Leithanien's in particular is the most classical of them all.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This country was born... from a Movement. A melody blending together ten tribes with different cultures. When language proves to be a barrier, music is the only means to communicate.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But why is that? Why would different wills produce similar experiences from the same melody?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Is there some kind of... power, binding both you and us?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Why do conflict and crisis always repeat in an endless spiral...? Why is it so hard to change Leithanien?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: I know. Your music is telling me that I've always known. It's just that that power... it keeps me from finding it!
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: The answer is in my hands. My teacher never lied to me.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: The golden melody... Leithanien's will... All of us Leithanians are trapped!
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Haha... So it's true. I've never really had a choice.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: It wasn't my fault.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: It wasn't my fault!
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Thank goodness.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: The scholar realizes that he is once again standing at the highest point of Ludwigs-Universität.
This is the first time in twenty-three years that he's earnestly gazed at the sunset outside.
The clouds are fluffy, and although they're completely soaked in blood, they yet maintain their original shapes.
This is Leithanien's evening glow.

Gerhard Hoffmann notices that his body and the Güldenesgesatz have fallen together on the spiral staircase, while his consciousness drifts out the window with the melody and dissolves into the clouds.
He has never felt so free.
Stay quiet for a moment. I want to let his emotions... linger at my fingertips for a little longer.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I've heard that you call yourself an executioner. You've witnessed so many deaths, but have you ever truly touched the last bout of emotion that bursts forth at their final moments?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: An executor is more concerned with the deceased's last testament.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You make the living believe that their wills will be carried out even after death, while I allow their most splendid emotions to live on in music.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Both of us substantiate the meaning of having lived. We just go about it in different ways.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I am here to execute my mission and nothing more. I have no need to listen to a sinner's sophistry.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: *sigh* We're family, and haven't seen each other for so long. Can't you at least hold a proper conversation, Federico? Who's to say I won't die tomorrow?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You intentionally put yourself in danger. It would not be entirely surprising if you did.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I wouldn't find it surprising either.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We're all bound to die. When we do, our bodies give nutrients back to the land and become a part of new life. This is the meaning of our flesh. It's the circle of life.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But what about the meaning of our wills? When our consciousness fades, they will return to chaos.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So what separates the living from the dead, one person from another, and us from the sunset and the breeze?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's our emotions, Federico.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If there is meaning to our lives outside of our bodies, if there truly is something that can resist the destined chaos...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Then it is only this very moment, all that I feel, and the melody transmuted from those feelings.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That's why, as long as I still breathe, I can't stop playing.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I am required to apprehend wanted criminals, but if necessary, I can also pull the trigger.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Oh, I don't doubt that.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It'll happen one day, and there's no doubt that it will be Federico Giallo who kills Arturia Giallo. But do you think that daylight can kill the dark night, order can kill chaos, and reason can kill emotion?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Layering metaphors cannot cover up the essential truth.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You are a criminal, and I am an executor. I pursue you in order to fulfill the contract that is my duty.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You believe uncertainty to be a kind of emotion. That's why you're always seeking answers through rational analysis. But it's not your rationality that's led you to me again and again. It's your confusion.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You saw and heard it yourself. Today, countless lives were lost in chaos.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If only you'd followed my advice and given up on me, instead lending your aid to that envoy of the Empress... With your skills, and how sharp you are, you could've easily found the one hiding in the shadows, manipulating the chaos.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But again and again, you choose to prioritize looking for me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You are where my duty lies. I will not regret my decision.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I know you won't.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But look. Now you've caught me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So... satisfy my curiosity, Federico. Do you feel no satisfaction, right this very moment?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Seize her.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: So you people came too.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Recover the Güldenesgesatz as well.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Arturia is my target.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Herr Federico Giallo, Executor of the Lateran Curia's Fifth Tribunal.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: It's extremely likely that the Sankta before you has committed what amounts to the highest offense in Leithanien. She must come with us for our investigation.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: I thought the Gendarmerie was in charge of the upcoming inquest.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's the Kaiserin's orders to take Arturia.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Does that mean that you cannot guarantee Arturia will be dealt with according to the law?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: As I said, these are the Kaiserin's orders.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: I have sent a total of twenty-seven explanatory letters, in addition to repeating my mission objective to the now-deceased officer-in-charge, Loris Bordin.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: In that case—
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Frau Jonas.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Would it be possible for Herr Executor to participate in Arturia's interrogation?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: That's not part of my orders. To Leithanien, Arturia is a most dangerous criminal. No one is to be allowed anywhere near her without Her Majesty's explicit permission.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Then I—
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: That includes you.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Will we meet again, Federico, before my consciousness fades away?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Jonas... They call her the cruelest executor in Grimmacht's Spire.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: How did she get here so fast? Did Grimmacht... I'll talk to her. I...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Herr Executor... Don't you want to chase after them?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: If Leithanien can ensure that Arturia will never commit a crime again, my highest priority mission objective will be considered complete.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: However, as she said, I feel no satisfaction in this.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It has become much quieter outside the spire, yet the black flames continue to burn.
Viviana has forgotten which floor of the spire she is on. The spiral stairs all look the same.
Her candlelight flickers a few times before finally going out.
Frau... Droste?
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: Pym? Why are you still here?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ha... Haha... I'm in pretty bad shape. At least this way I won't be a bother to the kids.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: You were burned by the black flames. Half your body is...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's fine.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: I'm glad I got to see you again. By seeing you, I can at least confirm that I haven't turned into some kind of monster that walks even in death.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: The disaster's been averted, right?
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: The Empresses' Voice, the Gesatzswächter... they're all here, right? Are the Witch King's remains all dead, and the students safe?
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: I suppose so.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hm. It's strange. I saw the captain just now.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: Herr Loris Bordin...?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: He said I did pretty well, and did the Gendarmerie proud. Once the ceremony's over, my mother will get the Kaiserin's black-gold medal.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: But that's only for those who've fallen...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's hopeless for me, right?
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: I don't want to lie to you.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Meine Dame, when I see you looking at me like that... It doesn't hurt so much anymore.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: Your candlelight... is so warm.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: When I first got to Zwillingstürme, I nearly gave up. I couldn't keep up with how exhausting the training was, day after day. Only when I saw that tiny light you held in the arena, lighting up every one of my... my...
attributes.name: Gendarmerie C

attributes.content: He did not deserve to fall into eternal slumber on these spiral stairs.
If he could have just a little more light, a little more warmth.
Viviana knows that she is not a lighthouse, but she is capable of that much.
Auf Wiedersehen, Pym.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: May this candlelight accompany you as you drift into eternal slumber.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Grimmacht's envoy said she's just up ahead.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Step aside, Cora. Let me take care of the rubble here first.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Let me do it. You've already...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Wait. These footsteps...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Viviana!
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Frau Löwenstein... Herr Reiner...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Good.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Meine Herr?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Let him get some rest. Raising the curtain by force took its toll on his body.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But... he's still standing.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: He'd never let himself collapse in front of so many.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Brandt's really worn himself out, all these years.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Before the battle, he saw me as my father.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: That's always weighed heavily on his mind.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Twenty-three years ago, House Hochberg suffered great losses at the Witch King's Spire, and because of his position as a Gesatzswächter, Brandt wasn't able to come to their aid in time.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Because of that, Ernst, his closest friend and the heir to the Hochbergs, perished in battle... That's also why your father Werner had to succeed him as Kurfürst.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The remorse he felt toward Ernst and Werner has been eating away at his soul all this time. And today, when forced to choose between destroying Sonata Spire and saving you, he chose you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I never imagined...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I knew he'd make that choice.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I'd have done the same.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I was so scared back there... I'm prepared to make any sacrifice, if necessary. But you... Not you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I'm glad we didn't lose you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...I'm one of the lucky ones. On my way here, I came across many who've passed away.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I did my best, but I wasn't able to rescue everyone.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The casters will figure out how to eliminate the black flames. The victims will be taken care of.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Things will get better.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: They won't have suffered for nothing. This place will be completely different tomorrow.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I'll make sure you get to see that for yourself, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I promise.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: What a beautiful sunrise.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: (Humming)
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Barrier.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Mm... Mmm? Hm...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We know a thing or two about your Arts, Meine Dame.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Now, neither you nor your cello are capable of making a sound.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: (Silent humming)
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You made up your mind.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The Voice of Mundane... I've been dying to have someone take it away. If you've no plans to use it as a bomb, then be my guest.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: So you finally believe me?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I... admit I owe you an apology. And a word of thanks. If it wasn't for you, then I might not be Ebenholz right now, but some other thing.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But please, spare me all this nonsense about 'trust' or what have you. I'd rather not see you pounce on me and knock me out with your sword the moment I spit out the words 'I trust you.'
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I wasn't planning to. For now.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...Well, that's nice.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Someone's playing the cello.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They're mourning the victims with music.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It was just like this when I first met Gerhard.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: He told me that... through music, the wills of the dead are carried on through us.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: He was so quiet and gentle. I really thought he was...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm an idiot, aren't I?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I couldn't even see through their masks. I couldn't even see... who was controlling my life.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: How I wish I could be more like... No matter how many obstacles he encountered, he never lost hope. He even smiled as he...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This piece...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Who's playing the cello up there?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The dormitory isn't far. Maybe a student?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: That's impossible.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Calm down. We can't expose ourselves yet.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It's exactly the same... How could it be exactly the same?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.text: The Sky is blue and fine,
The Breeze lilts by in Song;

attributes.content: Where did you learn to play like that?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Huh? I'm nothing special, really.
attributes.name: Motivated Student

attributes.content: Not your technique, you fool, your emotions! Where did you learn to play this cello piece almost exactly like he did?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No one else played like him. I checked over and over. After he died, I've been to so many places and listened to even more musicians play that same piece!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Who was your teacher?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Um... Arturia. My teacher's name is Arturia.
attributes.name: Motivated Student

attributes.content: Is she a Sankta? A Sankta with very long hair, who dresses plainly?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you know her too? I saw her just today. She told me to keep practicing here, without worrying about the sounds outside.
attributes.name: Motivated Student

attributes.content: ...Without worrying about the sounds?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That Sankta... Is she a remnant of the Witch King too?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: N-No, that's impossible. She's very kind.
attributes.name: Motivated Student
Ebenholz
attributes.content: Where is she? I need to see her. I need to question her myself! I...

attributes.name: Ebenholz
attributes.content: Ugh!
Another headache?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Did you know, Lessing? He and I... Everything in our lives was given to us by others. Our pain, our joy... our despair.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: So if even our hope...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Even our hope...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't know if I actually want that answer.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Have you thought it through?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Hohoh, what is there to think about? The school was burnt down by Herkunftshorn's embers. I could miss it all I want, but that wouldn't bring it back.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I've forgotten... How long have I been in Leithanien? Five hundred years? Longer?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: When I first got here, there was nothing. No nomadic cities, no spires, no nobles. Hah, back then, everyone lived in the forests by the lakes. They lit fires to eat, and used rocks to shelter from the wind.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: To us, a few decades are more than though for a city to rise and fall, a man to go from young to old, or a pair of close companions to have a falling out and go their separate ways.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: That's right. It's been but an instant since this place went from Vedunien to Zwillingstürme. I wonder what the city will be called next.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: And when that lamb with the rotten luck and a brain full of nothing but melodies is taken care of, I'll fulfill my promise to you. After that, I think I'll take a stroll around town.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: And once that's done...
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We'll leave.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Tell the nobles they can have a good night's sleep, for once.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I've already explained it to them, long ago.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Explained what? That Liches aren't like Vampires and don't get involved with Military Commission business, so they can rest easy that this place won't be the next Londinium?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Do you really believe they simply don't understand, Grimmacht?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: And are you really so whimsically unaware of who stands behind those nobles that want to chase the Liches out?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: You two can deal with the fallout afterwards.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: The Liches have indeed stayed here for far too long. Knowledge should never have taken the side of any one nation or race.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Do you even know how many Leithanian terms our brats use in their writing these days? It's absolutely outrageous!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: We should've left when Herkunftshorn bought the farm.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: This... is just a belated farewell.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: The white-haired Lich lifts his hand.
As though having been granted permission, a large number of slender silhouettes appear beneath the setting sun.

Perhaps they'd been standing there the whole time. They were simply masquerading as ordinary students and faculty. However, from this moment onwards, they are no longer concerned with how different they are from other Leithanians.
The Liches all raise their hands.
Countless paper-thin strands of silk extend from their bodies and into the dark clouds up above.
Then, a radiance like starlight comes falling down. Looking up, many of the students see the sunset, the night, and the sunrise all at once.
Within that brimming radiance, the dark flames on the earth are extinguished without a sound. Not long after, the silk-threaded shadows also disappear into the dream-like rain.
Ever since, no more trace of the Liches could be found in Leithanien's spires.
